Content:: The Parliament of Cambodia (Khmer: សភាតំណាងរាស្ត្រ, Sâphéa Tâmnangréastr [sapʰiə tɑmnaːŋ.riəh]) is the bicameral legislature of the Cambodia consisting of the Senate and the National Assembly. The parliament is composed of 187 members, 125 MPs and 62 senators. Parliament has two chambers. The National Assembly holds legislative power. In addition to the general law-making power, the National Assembly has specific powers regarding the national budget, taxes, administrative accounts, laws on general amnesty, international treaties and conventions, declarations of war, and the formation of the Royal Government.[1] The King and National Assembly each nominate two senators, bring the total to 61 members.  This Cambodia-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
